summary.text_en: Faraday discovered changing magnetic fields generate electric current! This is the principle of generators. Magnetism creates electricity, electricity creates magnetism - they're interconnected.

story.text_en: On August 29, 1831, Faraday rotated a magnet in his lab and was amazed to find current in a coil! This simple discovery changed the world. From humble origins with only elementary education, he became the greatest experimental physicist.

fun_facts.text_en: Faraday only attended elementary school, became a bookshop apprentice at 13, self-taught to greatness.
After attending chemist Davy's lecture, he wrote seeking employment. Davy was moved by his passion and hired him.
He refused many lucrative opportunities, saying: 'I must remain plain Michael Faraday.'

experiment.description_en: Quickly insert a magnet into a coil, the ammeter needle deflects! Remove the magnet, needle deflects opposite direction. When magnet is still, no current. This proves: only changing magnetic fields generate current.
experiment.why_en: Changing magnetic field creates electric field in wire, pushing electrons to flow as current.

simple_explanation.text_en: Imagine a magnet as an invisible force field. When you move the magnet near a coil, this field change pushes electrons in the coil to move, generating current! Like waving your hand creates wind.

impact.text_en: Faraday's discovery launched the electrical age! Without him, no generators, motors, transformers - modern civilization wouldn't exist. He transformed electricity from lab curiosity to world-changing force.

influenced_by.contribution_en: Discovered electric current creates magnetic field
Quantitative relationship between current and magnetic field

influenced.contribution_en: Mathematized Faraday's law, established electromagnetic theory
Built power systems, electrified the world

influence_chain.legacy_text_en: Oersted discovered electricity creates magnetism, Faraday discovered magnetism creates electricity, completing key step in electromagnetic unification. Maxwell summarized Faraday's experiments mathematically, predicting electromagnetic waves. Tesla and Edison transformed these theories into practical power systems.

quiz.question_en: When does induced current occur in a coil?
quiz.explanation_en: Induced current only occurs when magnetic flux through the coil changes. Moving magnet changes the flux.
